column1: '''''Hrólfs saga kraka''''' (English: ''Saga of King Hrolf kraki'') is an [[Old Norse]] [[Norse mythology
column2: saga]]. The saga is commonly held by [[J.R.R. Tolkien
column3: Tolkien]] scholars to be the main source for the idea behind the character [[Beorn]].<ref name=RME73>[[Tom Shippey]], ''[[The Road to Middle-earth]]'' (second edition), pp. 73-4</ref><ref name=MB/><ref name=AH164>{{HM

column1: Tolkien is known to have created a short story based on the ''Hrólfs saga kraka'', which he called ''[[Sellic Spell]]''.<ref name=MB>{{HM
In [[1933]], Tolkien's pupil [[Stella M. Mills]] published a translation ''[[The Saga of Hrolf Kraki]]''. Mills dedicated the book to Tolkien.<ref>{{webcite
column4: articlename=New Release: Stella M. Mills's translation of THE SAGA OF HROLF KRAKI
